references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper introduced AlphaGo, a groundbreaking AI system that demonstrated the power of combining deep learning with Monte Carlo Tree Search to achieve superhuman performance in Go, laying the foundation for many subsequent advances in AI, including reasoning language models.

references.paper_title: Mastering chess and shogi by planning with a learned model
references.reason: This paper introduced AlphaZero, which demonstrated the ability of reinforcement learning to master complex games from scratch without any prior domain knowledge, showcasing the power of reinforcement learning and self-play for AI development.

references.paper_title: Training verifiers to solve math word problems
references.reason: This paper introduced a novel approach to training large language models to solve mathematical word problems by training a verifier model, demonstrating the value of verification in improving reasoning capabilities.

references.paper_title: Chain-of-Thought prompting elicits reasoning in large language models
references.reason: This paper introduced chain-of-thought prompting, a simple yet effective technique for eliciting higher-quality reasoning from large language models, significantly impacting the field of reasoning with LLMs.

references.paper_title: Graph of Thoughts: Solving elaborate problems with large language models
references.reason: This paper introduced the Graph of Thoughts framework, which extends chain-of-thought prompting by allowing for more complex and flexible reasoning structures, thereby demonstrating the potential of graph-based reasoning for improving the capabilities of large language models.
